entry.title: Union Pacific 4014 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Union Pacific 4014 (pictured) has been the only Big Boy locomotive operating in the United States since 2019?

entry.title: fictional depiction of the moons of Mars (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the first fictional depiction of the moons of Mars predates their discovery by a century and a half?

entry.title: Mother and Child (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in Mother and Child, composed in 2002 by John Tavener for the vocal ensemble Tenebrae, organ and temple gong enter for the climax?

entry.title: 2022 Cure Bowl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 2022 Cure Bowl is the only one of the 2022–23 NCAA football bowl games scheduled to be played between FBS conference champions?

entry.title: a poem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Burton Raffel called Arthur Cooper's translation of a poem by Du Fu "exceedingly lame"?

entry.title: Claudia Meier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Minnesota legislator Claudia Meier cosponsored a bill freeing women from having to take their husbands' last names, and then took her husband's last name?

entry.title: Philippine embassy in Baghdad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the height of the war between Iraq and the Islamic State, diplomats of the Philippine embassy in Baghdad agreed to die together rather than be taken hostage?

entry.title: Oliver Hailey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that all three of playwright Oliver Hailey's Broadway productions closed after one regular performance?
